android.car

类 Car

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.car.Car

  • public final class Car
extends java.lang.Object
    Top level car API for embedded Android Auto deployments. This API works only for devices with PackageManager#FEATURE_AUTOMOTIVE Calling this API on a device with no such feature will lead to an exception.

    • 嵌套类概要

      static boolean isApiAndPlatformVersionAtLeast(int requiredApiVersionMajor, int minPlatformSdkInt)
      已过时。 
      - use getCarVersion().isAtLeast(CarVersion.forMajorVersion(requiredApiVersionMajor)) && getPlatformVersion().isAtLeast(PlatformVersion.forMajorVersion(minPlatformSdkInt)) instead.
      static boolean isApiAndPlatformVersionAtLeast(int requiredApiVersionMajor, int requiredApiVersionMinor, int minPlatformSdkInt)
      已过时。 
      - use getCarVersion().isAtLeast(CarVersion.forMajorAndMinorVersions( requiredApiVersionMajor, requiredApiVersionMinor)) && getPlatformVersion().isAtLeast( PlatformVersion.forMajorVersion(minPlatformSdkInt)) instead.
      static boolean isApiVersionAtLeast(int requiredApiVersionMajor)
      已过时。 
      - use getCarApiVersion().isAtLeast(CarVersion.forMajorAndMinorVersions( requiredApiVersionMajor)) instead
      static boolean isApiVersionAtLeast(int requiredApiVersionMajor, int requiredApiVersionMinor)
      已过时。 
      - use getCarVersion().isAtLeast(CarVersion.forMajorAndMinorVersions( requiredApiVersionMajor, requiredApiVersionMinor) instead

      • META_DATA_DISTRACTION_OPTIMIZED

        public static final java.lang.String META_DATA_DISTRACTION_OPTIMIZED
        This represents AndroidManifest meta-data to tell that Activity is optimized for driving distraction.

        Activities without this meta-data can be blocked while car is in moving / driving state.

        Note that having this flag does not guarantee that the Activity will be always allowed for all driving states.

        For this meta-data, android:value can be true (=optimized) or false.

        Example usage:

        另请参阅:
        常量字段值

      • META_DATA_REQUIRES_CAR_FEATURE

        public static final java.lang.String META_DATA_REQUIRES_CAR_FEATURE
        This represents AndroidManifest meta-data to tell that Application requires specific car features to work.

        Apps like launcher or installer app can use this information to filter out apps not usable in a specific car. This meta-data is not necessary for mandatory features.

        For this meta-data, android:value should contain the feature name string defined by OptionalFeature or ExperimentalFeature annotations.

        Example usage:

    • 方法详细资料

      • getCarVersion

        public static CarVersion getCarVersion()
        Defines the version of the Car APIs in the device.

        Starting on Android 13, the Car APIs can be upgraded without an OTA, so it's possible that these APIs are higher than the platform's.

      • getPlatformVersion

        public static PlatformVersion getPlatformVersion()
        Defines the version of the standard SDK APIs in the device.

        Its major version will be the same as android.os.Build.VERSION#SDK_INT for released build but will be android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES#CUR_DEVELOPMENT for platform still under development.

                                                                  int minPlatformSdkInt)

      • createCar

        @Deprecated
public static Car createCar(Context context,
                                         ServiceConnection serviceConnectionListener,
                                         Handler handler)
        已过时。 use createCar(Context, Handler) instead.
        A factory method that creates Car instance for all Car API access.

        Instance created with this should be disconnected from car service by calling disconnect() before the passed {code Context} is released.

        参数:
        context - This should not be null. If you are passing ContextWrapper, make sure that its base context is not null as well. Otherwise it will throw NullPointerException.
        serviceConnectionListener - listener for monitoring service connection.
        handler - the handler on which the callback should execute, or null to execute on the service's main thread. Note: the service connection listener will be always on the main thread regardless of the handler given.
        返回:
        Car instance if system is in car environment and returns null otherwise.

      • createCar

        @Deprecated
public static Car createCar(Context context,
                                         ServiceConnection serviceConnectionListener)
        已过时。 use createCar(Context, Handler) instead.
        A factory method that creates Car instance for all Car API access using main thread Looper.

        Instance created with this should be disconnected from car service by calling disconnect() before the passed {code Context} is released.

        另请参阅:
        createCar(Context, ServiceConnection, Handler)

      • createCar

        public static Car createCar(Context context)
        Creates new Car object which connected synchronously to Car Service and ready to use.

        Instance created with this should be disconnected from car service by calling disconnect() before the passed {code Context} is released.

        参数:
        context - application's context
        返回:
        Car object if operation succeeded, otherwise null.

      • createCar

        public static Car createCar(Context context,
                            Handler handler)
        Creates new Car object which connected synchronously to Car Service and ready to use.

        Instance created with this should be disconnected from car service by calling disconnect() before the passed {code Context} is released.

        参数:
        context - This should not be null. If you are passing ContextWrapper, make sure that its base context is not null as well. Otherwise it will throw NullPointerException.
        handler - the handler on which the manager's callbacks will be executed, or null to execute on the application's main thread.
        返回:
        Car object if operation succeeded, otherwise null.

      • createCar

        public static Car createCar(Context context,
                            Handler handler,
                            long waitTimeoutMs,
                            Car.CarServiceLifecycleListener statusChangeListener)
        Creates new Car object with Car.CarServiceLifecycleListener.

        Instance created with this should be disconnected from car service by calling disconnect() before the passed {code Context} is released.

        If car service is ready inside this call and if the caller is running in the main thread, Car.CarServiceLifecycleListener.onLifecycleChanged(Car, boolean) will be called with ready set to be true. Otherwise, Car.CarServiceLifecycleListener.onLifecycleChanged(Car, boolean) will be called from the main thread later.

        This call can block up to specified waitTimeoutMs to wait for car service to be ready. If car service is not ready within the given time, it will return a Car instance in disconnected state. Blocking main thread forever can lead into getting ANR (Application Not Responding) killing from system and should not be used if the app is supposed to survive across the crash / restart of car service. It can be still useful in case the app cannot do anything without car service being ready. In any waiting, if the thread is getting interrupted, it will return immediately.

        Note that returned Car object is not guaranteed to be connected when there is a limited timeout. Regardless of returned car being connected or not, it is recommended to implement all car related initialization inside Car.CarServiceLifecycleListener.onLifecycleChanged(Car, boolean) and avoid the needs to check if returned Car is connected or not from returned Car.

        参数:
        context - This should not be null. If you are passing ContextWrapper, make sure that its base context is not null as well. Otherwise it will throw NullPointerException.
        handler - dispatches all Car*Manager events to this Handler. Exception is Car.CarServiceLifecycleListener which will be always dispatched to main thread. Passing null leads into dispatching all Car*Manager callbacks to main thread as well.
        waitTimeoutMs - Setting this to CAR_WAIT_TIMEOUT_DO_NOT_WAIT will guarantee that the API does not wait for the car service at all. Setting this to to CAR_WAIT_TIMEOUT_WAIT_FOREVER will block the call forever until the car service is ready. Setting any positive value will be interpreted as timeout value.

      • connect

        @Deprecated
public void connect()
                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        已过时。 this method is not need if this object is created via createCar(Context, Handler).
        Connect to car service. This can be called while it is disconnected.
        抛出:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If connection is still on-going from previous connect call or it is already connected

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect from car service. This can be called while disconnected. Once disconnect is called, all Car*Managers from this instance become invalid, and getCarManager(String) or Car#getCarManager(Class) will return a different instance if it is connected again.

      • getServiceConnectionListener

        public ServiceConnection getServiceConnectionListener()

      • getCarManager

        public java.lang.Object getCarManager(java.lang.String serviceName)
        Get car specific service manager as in Context#getSystemService(String). Returned Object should be type-casted to the desired service manager.

        For example, to get the manager for sensor service, CarSensorManager carSensorManager = (CarSensorManager) car.getCarManager(Car.SENSOR_SERVICE);

        参数:
        serviceName - Name of service that should be created like SENSOR_SERVICE.
        返回:
        Matching service manager or null if there is no such service.

      • getCarManager

        public <T> T getCarManager(java.lang.Class<T> serviceClass)
        Get car specific service manager by class as in Context#getSystemService(Class). Returns the desired service. No type casting is needed.

        For example, to get the manager for sensor service, CarSensorManager carSensorManager = car.getCarManager(CarSensorManager.class);

        参数:
        serviceClass - The class of the desired service.
        返回:
        Matching service manager or null if there is no such service.

      • getCarConnectionType

        public int getCarConnectionType()
        返回:
        the type of currently connected car.

      • isFeatureEnabled

        public boolean isFeatureEnabled(java.lang.String featureName)
        Checks if {code featureName} is enabled in this car.

        For optional features, this can return false if the car cannot support it. Optional features should be used only when they are supported.

        For mandatory features, this will always return true.

      • enableFeature

        public int enableFeature(java.lang.String featureName)
        Enables the requested car feature. It becomes no-op if the feature is already enabled. The change take effects after reboot.
        返回:
        true if the feature is enabled or was enabled before.

      • disableFeature

        public int disableFeature(java.lang.String featureName)
        Disables the requested car feature. It becomes no-op if the feature is already disabled. The change take effects after reboot.
        返回:
        true if the request succeeds or if it was already disabled.

      • getAllEnabledFeatures

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllEnabledFeatures()
        Returns all =enabled features at the moment including mandatory, optional, and experimental features.

      • getAllPendingDisabledFeatures

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllPendingDisabledFeatures()
        Returns the list of disabled features which are not effective yet. Those features will be disabled when system restarts later.

      • getAllPendingEnabledFeatures

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllPendingEnabledFeatures()
        Returns the list of enabled features which are not effective yet. Those features will be enabled when system restarts later.
